page.title: 16Britannia Coconut Dancers :2
page.content: In the Coconut Dance the rhythm is tapped out on wooden discs ('nuts') fastened to the hands, waists and knees. The clogs ringing on the pavement also add to the tempo. In recent years the Britannia Coconutters have achieved national and international fame, appearing at festivals, on television and performing at the Llangollen Eisteddfod. A Lancashire dialect poem has been written about them which goes : "Eawr Nutters are comin', they're dancin' in t' street, Ther's crowds standin' watchin', all havin' a treat, In red and white costumes, wi' faces all black, An' t' coco-shells beatin' a-crack-a-jack-crack."
